New Records: Virat Kohli scored his 48th ODI century, his first in a successful World Cup run chase.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 103 off 97 balls, finishing the match with a six.
India won by seven wickets with 51 balls remaining.
Ravindra Jadeja took crucial wickets and a great catch.
Jasprit Bumrah took key wickets including Mahmudullah and Mushfiqur Rahim.
India successfully chased down 257 runs set by Bangladesh.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh won the toss and chose to bat first.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised the team's fielding and bowling efforts.
Virat Kohli expressed satisfaction with his performance and the team's momentum.
Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto acknowledged India's superior performance and hoped for better in the next match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in Pune.
Hardik Pandya suffered a minor injury and his condition will be assessed day by day.
India's next match is against New Zealand, while Bangladesh will face South Africa.
